definition: to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to

sentences.english: There is no man but feels (ie no man who does not feel) pity for starving children.
sentences.chinese: 没有人不同情那些嗷嗷待哺的孩子。

sentences.english: Some 2.2 million children were in families whose incomes went up.
sentences.chinese: 她们身后有着大约两百二十万的儿童在嗷嗷待哺。

sentences.english: Salvation presented itself in the form of a present.
sentences.chinese: 一个突如其来的礼物救赎了我嗷嗷待哺的心灵。

sentences.english: From feeding, to grow into a beautiful girl, handsome boy.
sentences.chinese: 从嗷嗷待哺，到长成美丽的姑娘，英俊的少年。

sentences.english: That would reduce the pressure on the land and the number of mouths to feed.
sentences.chinese: 计划生育可以减轻土地的压力，减少嗷嗷待哺的嘴巴。

sentences.english: She has a brood of hungry youngsters to look after.
sentences.chinese: 这只母袋鼩有一窝嗷嗷待哺的小家伙要照顾。

definition: lit. above are the elderly, below are the young (idiom)/fig. to have to take care of both one's aging parents and one's children/sandwich generation
pinyin: shang4 you3 lao3 xia4 you3 xiao3

definition: swaddling clothes/fig. early stage of development/infancy
supporting a wife and children/dragged down by having a family to feed
to provide for/to keep (animals, a family etc)/to raise animals/to feed and clothe/support/the necessities of life/to give birth
to suffer every possible torment (idiom); bitter hardship/to bear one's cross
no one to rely on (idiom); on one's own/orphaned/left to one's own devices
the old and the young/the youngest member of the family
